org.metastatic.rsync

Class DeltaDecoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.metastatic.rsync.DeltaDecoder

  • public abstract class DeltaDecoder
extends java.lang.Object
    The superclass of all classes that decode delta objects from an external, binary format.

    Subclasses MAY define themselves to be accessable through the getInstance(java.lang.String, org.metastatic.rsync.Configuration, java.io.InputStream) method by providing a one-argument constructor that accepts an InputStream and defining the system property "jarsync.deltaDecoder.encoding-name".

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static final DeltaDecoder getInstance(java.lang.String encoding,
                                             Configuration config,
                                             java.io.InputStream in)
        Returns a new instance of the specified decoder.
        Parameters:
        encoding - The name of the decoder to get.
        config - The configuration to use.
        in - The source of binary data.
        Returns:
        The new decoder.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If any parameter is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If there is no appropriate decoder available.

      • read

        public int read(java.util.List<Delta> deltas)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Read (decode) a list of deltas from the input stream.
        Parameters:
        deltas - The list of deltas to write.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any element of the list is not a Delta.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If any element is null.

      • read

        public abstract Delta read()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Read (decode) a single delta from the input stream.

        If this encoding provides an end-of-deltas marker, then this method is required to return null upon receiving this marker.

        Returns:
        The delta read, or null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
